page.title: 09Health
page.content: Although Cardross has a population of 2000 people, it has no hospital, dentist or doctor. The nearest hospital is in the Vale of Leven, about 6 miles away. 20% of Cardross people attend a doctor in Alexandria, 40% in Dumbarton and 40% in Helensburgh. The situation is the same for dental treatment. Cardross has no pharmacy and this makes it very difficult for old people and young families to obtain medicine. They have to travel to Helensburgh or Dumbarton with their prescriptions. The local Co-op does sell aspirin and cough medicine. Cardross will have to grow bigger before it gets its own doctor. Some people believe that a bigger village would spoil the concept of community life.
